completed.result: A new version (0.2.0) using Python and the PySide Qt bindings has been released. It is roughly feature equivalent to the last Java version.
completed.title: Release: Bring Python version of the game roughly to the state of the last Java version
completed.description: The last Java version (0.1.4) had a functional start screen, a preliminary editor showing a map and a game center dialog allowing to choose a scenario. All these features will very likely be part of the final game design because they are so essential. In order to release a Python version a Python version with roughly the same features should be created. This will attract attention to the project and allows us to test the Python release pathways. Do not include more features for now but rather break them down to individual tasks later.

available.title: Music: Compile a list of all sound effects likely to be used
available.description: Create a list of all sound effects likely to be needed. See here for more information.

available.title: UI: Compile a list of buttons that will most probably be needed in the game
available.description: Create a table giving each button a short but meaningful name and explain in one short sentence the function of each button. Indicate if the size is different from the standard size.

available.title: Music: Compose a few more pieces of background music
available.description: We could need a few more. Refer to the forum for discussions about the style. Please do not forget to provide a license agreement and as much raw (notation) data as possible.

available.title: UI: Develop a common design for buttons
available.description: We need a common style for button. Please refer to the forum for discussions about the style. Please do not forget to provide a license agreement and as much raw (notation) data as possible.

available.title: UI: Develop a common design for backgrounds of windows, button, elements, ...
available.description: There are many backgrounds that need to be filled. We need a common design for them. This probably needs some discussion. Woodlike/metal or a blurred map are ideas that might be of interest.

available.title: Battle Prototype: Create a GUI drawing a battle field and allowing to move place some units on it
available.description: For specifications have a look at the Game Definition Manual. No fancy graphics. Just a QGraphicsView for the battlefield, a toolbar above and a logging message QTextEdit below.

available.title: Trade Prototype: Create a GUI for allowing to set up trade preferences with different trade partners and resources
available.description: For specifications have a look at the Game Definition Manual. No fancy graphics. Just a QWidget that has all the necessary fields.

available.title: Tests: Write more tests
available.description: The project definitely needs more tests to run automatically. While there is currently only audio and some GUI in PySide there are possibilities to write more tests. Do it.

available.title: Music: Combining sound effects in one file and playing from this one file.
available.description: Sound effects will very probably be available in the wav format but may need cutting. Furthermore they must be compiled into a single ogg file (using an external encode on Windows). Automatize this. Then this file must be read and chunks from it must be played upon request and with minimal delay.

available.title: UI: Implement a specific font.
available.description: The designers will choose a font. Modify the GUI so that this font is used throughout the game.

blocked.title: Music: Compile a repository of sound effect files under compatible licenses
blocked.description: Search and find sound effect samples that can be used for the sound effects listed in the dependent task. Indicate time ranges within the files if reasonable. See here for more information.

blocked.title: Battle Prototype: Create internal data structures to hold armies
blocked.description: For specifications have a loot at the Game Definition Manual. An army is a list of units each with their respective stats and position on the battlefield. Load/save army to file.

blocked.title: Battle Prototype: Create GUI to load/save/create new army
blocked.description: Again nothing fancy, just the bare minimum so that it works.

blocked.title: Battle Prototype: Implement turns, selection and move of units
blocked.description: We also need a small info panel showing the units stats.

blocked.title: Battle Prototype: Implement attacking of units
blocked.description: For specifications have a loot at the Game Definition Manual.

blocked.title: Battle Prototype: Experiment with combat AI
blocked.description: Try to develop a simple one. Let it run against each other and against humans.

progress.title: Finish first comprehensive version of game specification
progress.description: Rules: The game specification is an extensive document describing all the various details of the game and how they interact. It needs public discussion and constant revising. But first it should be in a draft like state at least mentioning all the important parts as detailed as possible. In the next 2-3 months finish it and then publish it for public discussion.

progress.title: Programming: Improve the Editor screen, implement map view and edit nations dialog.
progress.description: The map is a central piece of the UI. Many layers (terrain, ressources, rivers, grid, borders, units, cities) need to be painted. Also the nations must be made customizable (color, name, ...).
